item.description: I am a scholar of the late medieval and early modern periods (c. 1300-1650). I study the interplay of gender, religion, and society in the British Isles, focusing on Scotland and Ireland. I am currently a Ph.D. student at Clemson University. I received my MA from College of Charleston in 2022 and my BA in 2020 from the University of Alabama.

Curriculum Vitae Cecilia J. Barnard

Education PhD in Digital History, Clemson University

Fall 2024-Present

Master of Arts, College of Charleston, Spring 2021-Fall 2022

Thesis: “FAIRIES, GHOSTS, CHARMS, AND HERBS: AN ANALYSIS OF THE SURVIVAL OF FOLK MAGIC IN SCOTLAND DURING AND AFTER THE REFORMATION”

GPA: 4.0

Undergraduate Studies: University of Alabama

Bachelor’s in arts in English and History, Summa Cum Laude

Overall GPA: 4.0 History GPA: 4.1 English GPA: 4.2
